评论概述: Changed a lot over the years
评论详情: My first pants were great, loved the cell phone pocket on the right. The second pair was good too. It was interesting that wrangler put a cellphone pocket on both sides. The alignment was a little off but I adjusted all fine. Third pair was too small for the waist and is now super thin fabric. I was just like ok, maybe I gained weight and my other pants have stretched so I ordered one size up and they are super baggy, whatever. It works with a belt but I then realized that the cellphone pocket is only on the left side now and I am unfortunately right handed. It was good while it lasted.

评论概述: Runs Big, Side Pockets Too Low
评论详情: I ordered a size 33w. Same size as my other pants. Checked the label and confirmed that it the size I received. Tried it on and it was very loose, like I could easily take it in an inch. Maybe I should have purchased 32w but all my other 33w pants fit snug. These pants feel like they will fall off if I get up too fast. Put a belt on and the problem is solved but I do really want to wear a belt all the time?? Not sure.  Other issue are the pockets on the legs. They sit too low where any item I put in those pockets end up resting on my knees. So when I walk it is constantly tapping my knee. I don't see a way to resolve this issue.  So while I can return these pants for a smaller size, that still leaves me with the issue of the side pockets being too low. I thought if I bought shorter pants the side pockets will sit higher but then I would be wearing pants too short. The length is perfect. I think the pockets are just placed wrong. Looking at the product image, it shows the side pocket sitting above the model's knee. However, if you check out the images from people who bought the pants, you can see the side pockets for them is sitting AT the knee just like on me.  I will be returning. Too bad. They are super comfortable, even though they are a little on the thin side.

I feel like I was cheated. These pants are tissue paper thin, I already have a hole in one of the pockets, and things easily slide out of your pocket if you're in an awkward position trying to wire light fixtures or whatever job you're doing. Never again with my money.

Pants were cool, colored nicely, and fit right, but the fabric felt pretty thin and ended up tearing.  One belt loop broke a few wears in and then a tear by one of the pockets took them out another few wears later. Got to wear them maybe 10 times… wouldn’t buy again
I am 84. Have 11 belts. 2 are 1" dress belts 9 are standard 1.5" wide. The  belts roll in the overly large belt loops and the waist rolls under. Very uncomforable.

It's not completely terrible overall, but I'm frankly sick of watching products I love that used to last slowly becoming more and more cheaply made, and not lasting nearly as long.

评论概述: A line with better fabric is needed.
评论详情: I have been wearing Wrangler's cargo pants for decades. After Bill Blass's demise, they are unbeatable in functionality, reliability, and comfortability. I have been buying these pants for years. They are great. I carry a lot of stuff and these pants have the perfect pocket layout for my EDC. However, the most recent pair I got has a slight design change that I do not like. The rear pockets are no longer sewn to the butt of the pants. They are free floating, this allows the pocket to be pulled completely out of the pocket hole. Then causes your wallet to fall out when you sit on the John. I will have to sew the pocket in like it is on older versions myself. Otherwise, they are geat, and the OD Green color isnt close to a military looking color. After a couple washes it looks like a grey man grey.
